title: Mastering First Conditionals for Real Situations
objectives: Understand Conditionals First at Beginner level
Apply Conditionals First in real conversations

vocabulary.example: If it rains, we will stay inside.

vocabulary.definition: verb tense for habits or facts
a situation that must be true
vocabulary.example: If you study, you will pass.

content.introduction: Welcome to this lesson on Conditionals First.
content.explanation: In this lesson, you will learn about Conditionals First at the Beginner level.
tips: Practice Conditionals First daily for best results.

exercises.question: Choose the correct sentence: a) If it rains, I will stay home. b) If it rains, I stay home.
If she ____ (be) tired, she will rest.
Describe a plan you will do if it is sunny tomorrow.

culturalNote: First conditionals are common in American English for making plans, giving advice, and expressing future possibilities.
